news_header: A two-year-old girl, Ivana, suffers severe burns from an Israeli missile strike in southern Lebanon as her family attempts to flee the conflict. Her father recounts the traumatic experience, while medical staff express their struggles treating civilian victims of war.
news_text: Ivana, a two-year-old girl, sustained third-degree burns on nearly half her body due to an Israeli missile strike in southern Lebanon. Her family was preparing to evacuate when the missile hit close to their home, causing chaos and destruction. Ivana is currently hospitalized in Beirut, where medical staff are working tirelessly to treat her and other burn victims amidst ongoing attacks on healthcare facilities. The situation highlights the toll of war on civilians, particularly children, as her father expresses his sorrow and frustration over the violence. Doctors fear that many more children like Ivana will suffer as the conflict continues, emphasizing that war ultimately leaves everyone as a loser.
